answers.answer: I know whem my aunt had it that she was able to get rid of it after she had my cousin. Ask your Dr.  They may want you to go on a diet afterwards...watching your sugar intake to see if it goes away.

Did you have any signals/symptoms that you know of?  I go in for the test in a couple of weeks and I'm scared I have it too.  I just feel really big for 7 months and I've been really thirsty this entire pregnancy.  Was it the same for you?

hi i dont mean to alarm you but this happened to my cousin when she was pregnant with her first baby she developed it around 28 weeks and was insulin dependent probly a little worse then you she was injecting around 4 times a day but still you need to be aware im sorry for saying this or worrying you but you really need to be careful make sure your baby is moving normaly and stuff but try not to be to parinoid her baby was still born at nearly 38 weeks due to meternal diabetes again sorry if tmi but the doctors never told her that it would really be a problem well wrong it was a big problem and also after the baby was born her diabetes went away for a week but sadly returned she is now injecting insulin up to 5 times a day and has a hard time keeping it under control she has since given birth to a lovely little girl who is nearly 3 best of luck to you and sorry again for tmi but the doctors dont tell you everything im sure you will be fine.

Chances are it will be gone after childbirth! It is usually due to the stress of pregnancy  if you have a family history of diabetes it may return later on in life. You can help avoid it by eating properly and exercising regularly!

question: Hello it is me again well went to see the doctor yesterday and sadly to say I gained 2 1/2 pounds in a week and my gluclose levels have been quite high all week and doctor decided to put me on insulin. So now I am injecting 20 units 2 a day for the diabetes. And she has decided that she is going to induce me on 5-1-06 instead of my due date of 5-15-06. And well I guess my next questions is what are my chances of getting rid of the diabetes after I have my baby? I had gestational diabetes with my 4th pregnancy but I was able to control it with just the diet and did not need insulin injections and I got rid of it after I had my daughter. Well sorry to take more of your time. I will be waiting for your answers thank you very much.
